SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Provide Cleaner URLs with Fewer Parameters

To reduce the number of URL variations that search engine bots encounter on your storefront, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now removes certain parameters from page URLs. This change improves the efficiency of bots crawling links on your storefront and simplifies the browsing experience for human users.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: The following parameters previously used in Product List page and Product Detail page URLs are deprecated and no longer included in any URLs:

mnu
viewState=ListView
viewState=DetailView

If any of the following parameters are empty, B2B Commerce for Visualforce no longer includes it in a URL:

portalUser
isCSRFlow
cclcl
cartId
NOTE If you enable canonical and alternate language URLs, the cclcl parameter is always included in the canonical URL for applicable pages.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, this change is available automatically.

Parameters in Storefront Page URLs

title: Improving Search Engine Bots Experience with Visualforce Commerce
